summary: Build a full-stack, production-ready E-Library Management System for BPS Mahila Vishwavidyalaya on the Internet Computer, featuring Internet Identity authentication, role-based access (Admin/Research Scholar/General Student), seat & 2-hour slot booking with reserved-seat rules, real-time availability, admin/user dashboards, and deployment-ready configuration.

existing_features.title: Implement Internet Identity authentication for the frontend and backend so users can sign in/out and the application can identify the caller Principal for all protected actions.

Create on-chain user and role management with roles: Admin, Research Scholar, General Student; ensure Admins can assign/change roles for any user and role-based access control is enforced on all privileged backend methods.

Implement seat/computer management with default total seats = 120 and reserved seats count = 20, creating bookable seats with a reserved flag (research-reserved vs general) and storing this configuration on-chain.

Implement a fixed 2-hour slot booking system with admin-configurable library operating hours, generating available slots per date based on the configured opening/closing times and enforcing one active booking per user at a time.

Provide seat availability and booking discovery endpoints so the frontend can show near real-time availability of seats per slot (per date), including which seats are available/unavailable for the signed-in userâ€™s role.

Build an Admin Dashboard that allows: viewing all users and their roles; assigning/changing roles; viewing all bookings (date, time slot, seat, user); cancelling any booking; configuring total seats, reserved seats count, and library timings.
Build a User Dashboard that allows: viewing available dates/slots and seats; booking a seat for a chosen slot; cancelling own booking(s); viewing booking history.

Ensure the application is production-ready for Internet Computer deployment: include deployment configuration, sensible defaults (120 seats, 20 reserved, default library timings), and sample data initialization that does not compromise security (e.g., no hardcoded admin secrets).

Create a clean, responsive, student-friendly UI in React + TypeScript using Tailwind CSS, with consistent navigation between User Dashboard and Admin Dashboard (when role permits), and English-only user-facing text.
Adopt and apply a coherent visual theme across the app (colors, typography, layout, component styling) suitable for a university library interface, avoiding a blue/purple-dominant palette.

new_feature_requests.summary: Internet Identity authentication with role-based access (Admin/Research Scholar/General Student) and admin role assignment
Seat/computer management: create 120 bookable seats with 20 reserved for Research Scholars and enforce booking eligibility rules
2-hour slot booking system with configurable library operating hours, one active booking per user, prevent double-booking, and real-time availability per slot
Admin dashboard: manage users/roles, view/cancel any booking, configure seats/reserved count and library timings
User dashboard: view availability, book/cancel own bookings, and view booking history
Frontend implementation using React + TypeScript (Vite) with Tailwind CSS; simple responsive student-friendly UI
Backend Motoko canister: on-chain storage for users/roles/seats/slots/bookings with access control, error handling, and clean data models
Deployment-ready Internet Computer project configuration including sensible defaults and sample data

Enforce booking eligibility and conflict rules: prevent double booking of the same seat and slot; allow Research Scholars to book research-reserved seats and general seats; prevent General Students from booking research-reserved seats; allow Research Scholars to book general seats even when reserved seats are available (no forced preference).

Implement clear backend data models and on-chain storage for users, roles, configuration (seats/reserved count/library timings), seats, slots (derivable), and bookings, with proper error handling and role-based access control for every update and admin-only read where appropriate.

architectural_notes: Platform: Internet Computer (IC) with Motoko backend canister and React+TypeScript (Vite) frontend.
Authentication via Internet Identity; enforce role-based access control for all privileged operations.

Booking rules: fixed 2-hour slots; one active booking per user; prevent double booking of same seat+slot; reserved-seat eligibility enforced (General cannot book reserved; Research may book general if reserved free).
Admin-configurable library operating hours, total seats, and reserved seats count.
Store users, roles, seats, slots, and bookings on-chain; include sensible defaults and sample data; production-ready (no mock/placeholder logic).
